  Static code analysis tools can discover vulnerabilities inside your code before they make their way to production.

  Integrate SAST into CI/CD so it automatically runs for every new PR

workflow_templates.name: SAST Workflow
workflow_templates.content:
name: SAST Workflow
trigger:
  on:
    - pull_request_created
    - pull_request_updated
jobs:
  static-code-analysis-python:
    runner: github_actions
    asset_type: repo
    steps:
      - name: Run Bandit
        uses: ghcr.io/jitsecurity-controls/control-bandit-slim:latest
        if: "python in ${{ context.languages }}"
        with:
          args: -r /code -f json -q -ll -iii
  static-code-analysis-golang:
    runner: github_actions
    asset_type: repo
    steps:
      - name: Run GoSec
        uses: ghcr.io/jitsecurity-controls/control-gosec-alpine:latest
        if: "go in ${{ context.languages }}"

workflow_templates.content:
name: SCA Workflow
trigger:
  on:
    - pull_request_created
    - pull_request_updated
jobs:
  software-component-analysis:
    runner: github_actions
    asset_type: repo
    steps:

        uses: ghcr.io/jitsecurity-controls/control-osv-scanner-alpine:latest
        if: "python in ${{ context.languages }}"
        with:
          args: --recursive \${WORK_DIR:-.}

        with:
          args: audit --json --production

name: Scan IaC for static misconfigurations

  Cloud misconfigurations occur when resources have not been constructed properly, leaving your systems vulnerable 
  to attack. Cloud environment misconfigurations can cause system outages, unwanted downtime, or security risks.
  Causes can include overly complex environments, insufficient security practice knowledge, and human error due to
  manual processes.

name: IaC Misconfiguration Detection Workflow
trigger:
  on:
    - pull_request_created
    - pull_request_updated
jobs:
  iac-misconfig-detection:
    runner: github_actions
    asset_type: repo
    steps:
      - name: Run KICS
        uses: ghcr.io/jitsecurity-controls/control-kics-alpine:latest
        if: "python in ${{ context.languages }}"
        with:
          args: scan -p /code -o /code/jit-report -f json --exclude-severities INFO,MEDIUM,LOW
          output_file: /code/jit-report/results.json

name: Create Incident Response plan

  You should have a clear incident response plan in place before listing your GitHub app in the marketplace. 
  You should have the capability to notify GitHub within 24 hours of a confirmed incident.
  For an example of an incident response workflow, see the "Data Breach Response Policy" on the SANS Institute 
  website. A short document with clear steps to take in the event of an incident is more valuable than a lengthy 
  policy template.

item_template.name: Scan infrastructure for runtime misconfigurations
item_template.content:
namespace: jit.infrastructure
name: Scan infrastructure for runtime misconfigurations
description: |
  Cloud misconfigurations occur when resources have not been constructed properly, leaving your systems vulnerable 
  to attack. Cloud environment misconfigurations can cause system outages, unwanted downtime, or security risks. 
  Causes may include overly complex environments, insufficient security practice knowledge, and human error due to 
  manual processes.
summary: |
  Jit will ask your input to determine compliance with this item.
workflows:
  - uses: jitsecurity-controls/jit-plans/workflows/workflow-runtime-misconfiguration-detection@latest
tags:
  layer: infrastructure
  risk_category: supply_chain_attack

workflow_templates.name: Infrastructure Runtime Misconfiguration Detection Workflow
workflow_templates.content:
name: Infrastructure Runtime Misconfiguration Detection Workflow
trigger:
  on:
    - schedule("0 8 * * *")
jobs:
  runtime-misconfig-detection:
    runner: jit
    asset_type: aws_account
    steps:
      - name: Run Prowler
        uses: ghcr.io/jitsecurity-controls/control-prowler-alpine:latest
        with:
          args: account_ids="$AWS_ACCOUNT_IDS"

item_template.name: Scan code for hard-coded secrets
item_template.content:
namespace: jit.code
name: Scan code for hard-coded secrets
description: |
  Hard-coded secrets can be exploited by attackers to gain unauthorized access to the password-protected asset.
summary: |
  Integrate secret scanner into CI/CD so automatically runs for every new PR.
workflows:
  - uses: jitsecurity-controls/jit-plans/workflows/workflow-secret-detection@latest
tags:
  layer: code
  risk_category: secret_leaks
  compliance:soc2: CC7.1
  compliance:iso-27001: A.12.6.1

workflow_templates.name: Secret Detection Workflow
workflow_templates.content:
name: Secret Detection Workflow
trigger:
  on:
    - pull_request_created
    - pull_request_updated
jobs:
  secret-detection:
    runner: github_actions
    asset_type: repo
    steps:
      - name: Run Gitleaks
        uses: ghcr.io/jitsecurity-controls/jit-plans/control-gitleaks-alpine:latest
        with:
          args: detect --config /config/gitleaks.toml --source /code -v --report-format json --report-path /tmp/report.json --redact --log-opts "-1"
          output_file: /tmp/report.json

item_template.name: Conduct periodic vulnerability scans
item_template.content:
namespace: jit.infrastructure
name: Conduct periodic vulnerability scans
description: |
  You should conduct regular vulnerability scans of production infrastructure. You should triage the results of 
  vulnerability scans and define a period of time in which you agree to remediate the vulnerability. If you are not
  ready to set up a full vulnerability management program, it's useful to start by creating a patching process. For 
  guidance in creating a patch management policy, see this TechRepublic article [Establish a patch management 
  policy](https://www.techrepublic.com/blog/it-security/establish-a-patch-management-policy-87756/)
summary: |
  Jit will ask your input to determine compliance with this item.
workflows:
  - uses: jitsecurity-controls/jit-plans/workflows/workflow-manual-checker@latest
    with:
      template: jitsecurity-controls/jit-plans/templates/manual/template-vulnerability-scan.yml@latest
tags:
  layer: infrastructure
  risk_category: vulnerability
  compliance:soc2: CC7.1
  compliance:iso-27001: A.12.6.1

  Web application scanning, also referred to as web application vulnerability scanning or web application security 
  scanning, crawls a website for vulnerabilities within web applications. Scanning software is called web application 
  scanners or vulnerability scanners.

workflows:
